title: Xenosaga Episode 1 Der Wille Zur Macht Disk 2
description:
And here&#039;s disk 2-if you want disk 3, SEED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Okay, just so you know, here&#039;s the gumpf in the readme file, with a slight change....enjoy!

Please note downloading games you do not own is a crime! So don&#039;t do it...or get caught doing it...

This is the first disk of the US NTSC version of Xenosaga Episode 1: Der Wille Zie Macht. I ripped it from my version as the Sir Alucard torrent is pretty much dead. I&#039;ll seed as long as I can, but please seed as much as you download! I&#039;ll upload disk 2 as soon as I verify it works correctly and have enough peopl seeding disk 1 - usual rules folks!

I haven&#039;t split it into a multi-part file as some people find them difficult to use and aren&#039;t sure what to do with them. This file is an
iso, so you should be able to burn it using Nero, Alcohol or any number of burning programs. Personally, I recommend Alcohol 120% for this game.

I also recommend high quality DVD disks! I can&#039;t stress that enough! Don&#039;t drop a comment about it not working if you&#039;re using crappy disks, as that&#039;s probably your problem, not the iso. This works on my ancient, first model, flip-lid-added PS2, so hopefully you shouldn&#039;t have any problems.

Now for the specific stuff:

*ISO format file
*4.16GB in size (Disk 1)
*4.36GB in size (Disk 2)
*4.16GB in size (Disk 3)

(Slightly different from the read me file - I screwed up, this torrent took 11 hours to rip and zip, so sue me!)
*SAVE AT THE ELSA AT THE ABANDONED PORT!!! On disk 1 this is the point where the disk will crash after you tell Matthews you&#039;re ready to leave, and so you need to save on the ship before then. When the disk ends, switch off your console, boot up Swap Magic (if you&#039;re not modded) and then boot up the second disk. Load your save and &#039;viola!&#039; you&#039;re on disk 2.
*SAVE AT THE SONG OF NEPHILIM!!! On disk 2 for the same reason as above! Just boot up disk 3 instead and you&#039;re almost finished!

And thanks to......alkohol on the Afterdawn forums. Without your
guide, I couldn&#039;t have played a game I bought more than a year ago!!! (and that was in 2007) and to whomever made the original ripkit for automizing the process.

Hope this helps anyone who can&#039;t play DVD9 games!

Have fun,
C
